.

Itoh (1995) transferred this species to
Miridiba
and synonymized it with
Hippotrichia hainana Arrow, 1948
without justification. Coca-Abia (2008) studied the types and indicated holotypes for
M. sus (MFNB)
and
H. hainana (BMNH)
. However, Moser (1912) and Arrow (1948) never indicated how many specimens they studied. Therefore, these holotype indications by Coca-Abia (2008) were incorrect (Art. 73.1 ICZN). Hence, the ‘holotypes’ remain syntypes , and other syntypes may be found. In fact, the first author of this work found a syntype of
H. hainana
in the BMNH collection, which is designated as lectotype herein.
Miridiba sus
shows features of the external morphology and male genitalia, which characterize
Miridiba
and morphotype I “
Trichophora
”. Thus, this species is included in this genital morphotype.
